You need [.insertBefore()][1] > Insert every element in the set of matched elements before the target. *Code* $('#child').insertBefore('#parent') $(function() { $('#child').insertBefore('#parent') });
many other existing divs
parent
child
many other existing divs
Alternatively you can also use [`.before()`][2] > Insert content, specified by the parameter, before each element in the set of matched elements. $("#parent").before($('#child')); $(function() { $( "#parent").before($('#child')); });
many other existing divs
parent
child
many other existing divs
[1]: http://api.jquery.com/insertbefore/ [2]: http://api.jquery.com/before/

The `.before()` and `.insertBefore()` methods perform the same task. The major difference is in the syntaxâ€”specifically, in the placement of the content and target. [1]: http://api.jquery.com/insertbefore/ [2]: http://api.jquery.com/before/
